Pre-lobby battlerite system We know it was annoying for the most of ppl that you get bad team combo, no healer combo, you get blindly countered etc. Since battlerite season 1, we got pre-game lobby where we have order of picks and chat so we can assemble the team better. Most of the people are one trick heroes so it won’t matter much for them, but yet at least someone can change. This is a really good feature, as if you are 2nd to pick, you can counter pick their first pick or you can swap with your first pick in case you are one trick.  This feature should make our game easier. … [Read more...] about Battlerite official first season review by MMO Boosting Service

Breach is a third person co-op action RPG with both modern Earth and mythological elements, with modern classes like Engineer and Sniper that contrast classes like Lich and Necromancer. Breach enters paid Steam early access in January 2019, and is planning to launch as free-to-play before summer 2019. … [Read more...] about Elementalist Class Announced for Breach

2016 was one eventful year for ad tech industry. Client side Header Bidding went mainstream. Publishers got heavy-handed with anti-ad block measures with varying successes and failures. Fake news registered on the radar of mainstream media and ad tech took the flack for it. Ad viewability adoption increased, creating panic among publishers. Then, the year wrapped up with a bang as WhiteOps uncovered a ubiquitous, million-dollar ad fraud ring called Methbot. … [Read more...] about State of Ad Tech: 2016, Year In Review
